abstract: Visa, the biggest credit card network in the United States, took its first official step Friday toward becoming a public company, outlining to federal regulators how it proposes to restructure and combine its global operations.
lead_paragraph: Visa, the biggest credit card network in the United States, took its first official step Friday toward becoming a public company, outlining to federal regulators how it proposes to restructure and combine its global operations.

headline.main: Visa Takes First Step Toward I.P.O.
